channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.description:
About me I am currently a PhD student in biology at East Carolina University. I am fascinated by spiders and their venoms, and I am currently researching how venom has evolved in spiders in the Michael Brewer Lab.
I am originally from a small town in rural northwest Georgia called Cedartown. I spent the entire first 18 years of my life in that town, and graduated in a class of about 200 students.

+++ title = “About Hugo” date = “2014-04-09” menu = “main” +++ Hugo is a static site engine written in Go. It makes use of a variety of open source projects including: Cobra Viper J Walter Weatherman Cast Learn more and contribute on GitHub. Setup Some fun facts about Hugo: Built in Go Loosely inspired by Jekyll Primarily developed by spf13 on the train while commuting to and from Manhattan. Coded in Vim using spf13-vim Have questions or suggestions?

Recent publications TJ Cole, MS Brewer. toxify: a deep learning approach to classifying animal venom proteins. (In prep), 2018. Source Code TJ Cole, MS Brewer. FUSTr: a tool for finding Families Under Selection in Transcriptomes. In PeerJ, 2018. PDF Source Code TJ Cole, RA Hataway. Prescribed burning affects a measure of fitness in Ctenus hibernalis (Araneae:Ctenidae) at Oak Mountain State Park, Shelby County, Alabama.
